column4: Bolivia to invest in billion-dollar lithium deal with ACI Systems
column5: LA PAZ Bolivia will manufacture and market lithium batteries along with  German company ACI Systems GmbH  which will invest $1.3 billion in the project  the country's manager of the lithium deposits told the Bolivian state radio on Saturday.

column4: Bolivia to invest in billion-dollar lithium deal with ACI Systems

column4: Acxiom CEO says data industry bracing for regulation
column5: SAN FRANCISCO Companies that buy and sell consumer data are preparing for increased scrutiny from U.S. lawmakers after a scandal over how social network Facebook handles personal information  Acxiom Corp's chief executive said on Friday.

column4: Apple offers battery replacement for some MacBooks after flaws reported
column5: Apple Inc  on Friday said component failure in a limited number of MacBook Pros has caused built-in battery to expand  adding  it will offer worldwide free replacement for such batteries.

column4: Artist Frida Kahlo's family says judge blocks improper use of brand
column5: MEXICO CITY A Mexican judge has blocked a company associated with U.S. toymaker Mattel Inc from commercializing the image of artist Frida Kahlo  her family says  as it seeks to halt sales of a Barbie doll styled after the influential artist.

column4: Finnish drug maker Orion to sell diagnostic test business for $200 mln
column5: HELSINKI Finnish drug maker Orion  said on Saturday it has agreed to sell its Diagnostica division to a Nordic private equity company Axcel Management for 163 million euros ($200 million).

column4: Finnish drug maker Orion to sell diagnostic test business for $200 mln
column5: HELSINKI  April 21 Finnish drug maker Orion said on Saturday it has agreed to sell its Diagnostica division to a Nordic private equity company Axcel Management for 163 million euros ($200 million).

column4: Canada's Stars Group snaps up Sky Bet for $4.7 billion
column5: LONDON Canadian gaming company The Stars Group Inc  said on Saturday it had agreed to buy Sky Betting and Gaming from owners CVC Capital Partners and Sky PLC   in a deal worth $4.7 billion.

column4: Canada's Stars Group snaps up Sky Bet for $4.7 billion
column5: LONDON  April 21 Canadian gaming company The Stars Group Inc said on Saturday it had agreed to buy Sky Betting and Gaming from owners CVC Capital Partners and Sky PLC  in a deal worth $4.7 billion.

column4: Telecom standards group puts new technology on hold in wake of U.S. probe
column5: WASHINGTON A telecommunications standards organization - GSMA - said on Saturday it is delaying implementation of a new cellphone technology due to a U.S. government probe of alleged coordination between the group  AT&T Inc  and Verizon Communications Inc  to hinder consumers from easily switching wireless carriers.

column4: U.S. said to investigate AT&T  Verizon over wireless collusion claim: source
column5: WASHINGTON The U.S. has opened a probe into alleged coordination by AT&T Inc  Verizon Communications and a telecommunications standards organization to hinder consumers from easily switching wireless carriers  a person briefed on the matter said on Friday.

column4: UPDATE 5-U.S. said to investigate AT&T  Verizon over wireless collusion claim -source

column4: REFILE-UPDATE 1-Fresenius Medical sells U.S. Sound Inpatient for $2.15 bln
column5: BERLIN  April 21 German dialysis specialist Fresenius Medical Care is selling its majority shareholding in Sound Inpatient Physicians Holdings for $2.15 billion  it said on Saturday.

column4: Ford tells WPP it will take bids from other ad agencies
column5: LONDON Ford Motor Company  said on Saturday it will take bids on some of its advertising managed by WPP   adding to uncertainty around the British ad giant after last week's exit of founder Martin Sorrell.

column4: India's HDFC Bank Q4 net profit rises 20.3 pct to record
column5: MUMBAI  April 21 HDFC Bank Ltd  the second-biggest Indian lender by assets  on Saturday reported fourth-quarter net profit rose about a fifth to a record  although its bad loans ticked up.

column4: LATAM Airlines union rejects new contract offer  continues strike
column5: SANTIAGO A union of flight attendants for LATAM Airlines subsidiary LAN Express rejected a new contract offer from the Chile-based carrier on Friday  continuing a 10-day-old strike that has affected more than 270 000 passengers.

column4: Twitter bans ads from Russia's Kaspersky Lab
column5: Twitter Inc said on Friday that it has banned ads from Moscow-based Kaspersky Lab  saying the cyber-security company's business model conflicts with advertising rules and citing U.S. government claims that Kaspersky has ties to Russian intelligence agencies.
